page.title: 01GARTMORE VILLAGE
page.content: Gartmore sits on a hill above the Kelty Burn, on the edge of the Queen Elizabeth Forest. To the north are the Menteith hills, to the west- L.Lomond, to the south the Fintry Hills and Glasgow. On a clear day to the east you can see Stirling Castle and the Wallace Monument. Of the 300 villagers most work in Glasgow or Stirling; only a few work locally. Houses range from tiny cottages to large detached villas mostly along the Main Street. "Gartmore Song" "Hurrah for the Goualin,hurrah for the Ben, The Forth & the Kelty, the wood and the glen, O, for handsome young lassies and stalwart young men, That's reared in Dalmary and Gartmore" Goualin - local hill; Ben - Ben Lomond Dalmary - nearby small village
